name: Woningbouwcorporatie - Klimaat Risico Analyse
description: Comprehensive climate risk assessment for new housing development sites. Includes current + 2050 scenarios for heat stress, flooding, drought, precipitation extremes, and social vulnerability. Ideal for feasibility studies, climate adaptation planning, and sustainable building design.

datasets.comment: Social vulnerability to heat stress - identify neighborhoods requiring extra heat mitigation measures
Current perceived temperature (heat island baseline) - site-specific heat stress assessment
Urban heat island intensity - prioritize cooling infrastructure
Distance to cooling locations - evaluate accessibility to parks/water for heat relief
Shade coverage on paths - plan green corridors and street trees
Vulnerable elderly population - design cooling centers and community spaces
Current green space percentage - identify green deficit areas
Paved area percentage - assess heat absorption and runoff risk
Water surface percentage - evaluate cooling potential and water features
Current heavy rain days (>15mm) - baseline for drainage system design
Future heavy rain days (2050 high scenario) - future-proof water management
Current extreme rain days (>25mm) - assess flood risk baseline
Future extreme rain days (2050 low scenario) - conservative flood planning
Current annual precipitation - water balance for green roofs/gardens
Future annual precipitation (2050) - long-term water infrastructure sizing
Flood-safe zones (T=1000) - critical infrastructure placement
Dry floors during extreme flooding - building safety assessment
Future groundwater flooding risk - foundation design requirements
Current 10-year precipitation deficit - drought baseline for landscaping
Future drought risk (2050) - select drought-resistant vegetation
Nature drought sensitivity - biodiversity integration planning
Water salinization at 3m depth - vegetation and foundation material selection
Current frost days - baseline for building materials and utilities
Future frost days (2050) - reduced frost action on foundations/pipes
Nature classification threats/opportunities - biodiversity net gain planning
Municipality boundaries - administrative context for climate policies

use_cases: Climate risk assessment for new housing development sites
Heat stress mitigation planning (green infrastructure, cooling centers)
Flood-resilient building design (drainage, foundations, safe zones)
Social vulnerability analysis for community facility placement
Environmental impact assessments for housing projects
